ext_description.message: Search for text on a webpage and replace it with different text.

saveApplyPageReload.message: Save and apply on page reload

Saveandapply.message: Save and apply on page reload

help_title.message: Help page for search and replace

next_vs_all_p1.message: To replace the first occurrence of the search term, press Replace Next. You can continue to press the button until there are no more occurrences.

next_vs_all_p2.message: To replace all occurrences of the search term, press Replace All.

next_vs_all_p3.message: There is currently no undo function. If you make a mistake, you can reload the page to restore the original text. However, you will lose any unsaved changes in text editors and in text input fields.

replace_editors.message: Replacing text in editors and text fields
replace_editors.description: Explanation about replacing text in editors and text fields

replace_editors_p1.message: To replace text in text editors or input boxes you should check the Input fields only? check box.
replace_editors_p1.description: Explanation about replacing text in editors and text fields

replace_editors_p2.message: To replace text in text editors or input boxes you should check the Input fields only? check box. Otherwise, the search text will be replaced throughout the entire HTML, possibly breaking the page. To avoid changing hidden input fields, you should also check the Visible elements only? check box.
replace_editors_p2.description: Explanation about replacing text in editors and text fields

Replacing_anywhere.message: Replacing text anywhere on the page
Replacing_anywhere.description: Explanation about replacing text anywhere on the page

Replacing_anywhere_p1.message: To replace text that is contained within a HTML, contained within a text editor and contained within a text field, you should check the Replace HTML? check box.
Replacing_anywhere_p1.description: Explanation about replacing text anywhere on the page

Replacing_anywhere_p2.message: To replace text that is not contained within a text editor and not contained within a text field, leave the Input Fields only? and Only change visible content? boxes unchecked.
Replacing_anywhere_p2.description: Explanation about replacing text anywhere on the page

Replacing_anywhere_warning.message: WARNING: This setup will alter the page HTML and may break the page. You can restore the page by reloading, but you will lose any unsaved changes in text editors and in text input fields.
Replacing_anywhere_warning.description: Explanation about replacing text anywhere on the page

Matching_case.description: Explanation about matching the case of text

Matching_case_p1.message: If you need to replace THIS but not This then you should use the match case option.
Matching_case_p1.description: Explanation about matching the case of text

Matching_case_p2.message: The following setup will match Condo but not condo. It will replace Condo with apartment in text fields that are visible on the page.
Matching_case_p2.description: Explanation about matching the case of text

Matching_whole_p1.message: If you need to replace the word partial but not partially then you should use the Match whole word? option.

wildcards_and_regex.description: Explanation about wild cards and regular expressions

wildcards_and_regex_p1.message: If you need to match a partial search term then you should check the Regular Expressions check box and specify a wild card. You will need to have a very basic knowledge of regular expressions to use this feature. I recommend regexpal for testing
wildcards_and_regex_p1.description: Explanation about wild cards and regular expressions

Replacing_wordpress_p1.message: WordPress is currently on version 6.6, as of March 2023. The post editor has changed significantly since this extension was created and a new setup is required to replace text in WordPress.

Save_apply.message: Save and apply on page reload
Save_apply.description: Save and apply on page reload

Save_apply_p1.message: You can check the Save and apply on page reload check box to save your search and apply it on subsequent page reloads. These will take and re-opened your browser.
Save_apply_p1.description: Save and apply on page reload

Save_apply_multi_p1.message: If multiple rules apply to the same page, the rules will be applied in order of most specific to least specific. For example:

Save_apply_multi_p2.message: This means that any changes applied by the first rule will be fed into the subsequent rules. In the above example, the text Example will have been replaced by the rule matching http://www.example.com/a/deeper/nested/page. Subsequent rules will therefore have no effect.

ReportingIssuesWarning.message: Remember to REFRESH the page on which you wish to replace text after installing.

ReportingIssuesInfo.message: If the page has broken after using the extension, try refreshing the page, and then checking Input fields only? and Only change visible content? before performing a search and replace.

ReportingIssues_p1.message: If you find a bug, please provide a detailed report on the Chrome Extension Store or on GitHub.

Rate_on_store.message: Please rate ★★★★★ on Chrome Store if the extension helps you!

no_saved_instances.description: message to tell user that no rules were found

matches.description: message to tell user how many instances of the search term were found
